title: Control Level Comparison Design for Enhancing Online Science Learning Efficiency

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding advanced scientific concepts and experience in basic experimental design
context.additional_context: Science expert training course conducted in a smartphone-based LMS environment, featuring a learner population with limited time management skills and an assessment-driven curriculum structure

learning_goals: Learners can select an efficiency-based approach—either structured or flexible sequencing—with over 80% accuracy in the scientific problem-solving process
Learners can compare and explain cognitive load levels under fixed-path (low autonomy) and autonomous-path (high autonomy) learning conditions within three months
Learners can develop strategies to reduce learning time by over 20% without significant performance differences between control levels in summative assessments

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
